description:
About us
If you have a "strategy brain", like to do things the right way, and enjoy being behind the scenes, this may be a great fit!
We are a bold, fast-paced small business helping business owners who feel stuck achieve their next big revenue goal while making a big impact in the causes they care about.
Our work environment includes:

 Work-from-home days
 Growth opportunities
 Casual work attire

This is an exciting new company where your work matters and the work you is helping make people's lives better. If you like to make a difference, this may be the perfect opportunity for you!
General Manager

 Full Time Position
 Part of the job is executive assistant, part of the job is overseeing key operations, and part of the job is rolling up your sleeves and getting it done.
 Combo virtual/in person meetings 2x per week

Character Qualities: 
Trustworthy, detailed, excellent writer, and enjoys editing and catching grammatical mistakes. Enjoys implementing new ideas. Creative marketing mind with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organization and planning skills in a fast-paced environment. Excellent time management skills and the ability to multitask and prioritize various projects. Experience with digital marketing forms such as social media marketing and content marketing.
Enjoys making things happen and problem-solving at quick speeds. Works well under pressure and tight deadlines. Coachable and teachable — willing to give and receive feedback.
Experience with Gmail, Dropbox, YouTube, Excel, and Microsoft Word.
Tasks Include: 

 Run and manage CEO’s calendar
 Paying business bills
 Implement email campaigns on behalf of the CEO
 Coordinating marketing projects from start to finish
 Implementing podcast/business marketing initiatives to generate more listeners, reviewers, and book buyers
 Managing payroll
 Creating and maintaining client and consultant relationships
 Manage CEO’s inbox and reply to emails
 Managing/overseeing relationship with video production team
 Managing/overseeing relationship with social media marketing team
 Managing/overseeing relationship with website development team
 Responding to social media comments on platforms including Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn
 Print items

What does winning in this position look like?

 All details and daily minutia have been taken care of so CEO can focus on growing the business
 Implementing proactive calendar for social media and marketing initiatives
 Building national platform with a rapidly growing audience
 Manage details and perception of CEO’s personal brand
 Seeing the tangible impact you can have on improving people’s lives

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $56,582.75 - $62,489.22 per year
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 Paid time off

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday
 On call

Supplemental pay types:

 Signing bonus

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Arlington, TX 76016
positionName: General Manager for a growing small business

description:
Job Description
  The ideal Salesperson is passionate about fashion and styling and has the ability to cultivate and grow a customer following, both digitally and in-store.
 
  A day in the life…
 
   Set and achieve sales goals, for both in-store and digital selling with effective use of selling tools (inclusive of text and social media)
   Build lasting relationships with customers
   Give the best service to our customers on their terms
   Provide honest and confident feedback to customers about style and fit
   Seek fashion and product knowledge to build your expertise
   Work with the team to keep the department customer ready, which means filling orders, stocking, re-merchandising, price markdowns, and light cleaning
   Grow relationships by opening new Nordstrom Rewards program accounts
   The hours and schedule for this position will vary by week depending on business needs
   This role may require you to be flexible to occasionally performing work/duties in a department other than the one you were hired into
 
 
  You own this if you have…
 
   Excellent communication and people skills
   A self-motivated, goal oriented focus
   Strong interest to use networking and technology to achieve sales goals
   The ability to excel in a team environment
   The ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
   Organization and follow through
   The ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs
 
 
  We’ve got you covered…
 
  Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
 
   Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
   Life Insurance and Disability
   Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
 
 
  A few more important points...
 
  The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.
 
  Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
 
  Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.
 
  © 2022 Nordstrom, Inc
 
  Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.

Payment Processing Specialist 
  Summary 
 As a Payment Processing Specialist, you will use a variety of systems to handle client payments, updating banking information, and answering questions about payments for internal and external customers. You will work closely with multiple operational units to provide seamless service excellence and customer confidence with quality, urgency, and caring curiosity. 
  Key Responsibilities 
  
  Provide accurate, valid, and complete information to authorized customers, agents, and TPAs - Including policy information, interpretation, coverages, products (validating caller identification and authority) 
  Accurately process client payments and disbursements in a timely fashion, adhering to team standards for completion (SLAs). 
  Research customer requests to ensure proper documentation and procedural protocols are followed. 
  Use various reports to monitor and track activities ensuring all accounts are balanced, cleared, and audit ready. 
  Assist leaders/teammates in researching and resolving difficult (escalated) problems, resulting in follow-up with clients, agents, and/or colleagues. 
  Document work by following standard procedures and communicate with teammates on task completion. 
  Identifies opportunities to improve efficiencies and work with team to suggest and implement process improvements. 
  Evaluate your Quality Assurance reviews. 
  Support projects and special assignments, as needed. 
  Support immediate requests of all incoming phone calls and emails by processing payments, confirming policy information, and managing account and/or policy detail changes. 
  Meet performance goals for individuals and team in the areas of efficiency, accuracy, quality and customer satisfaction.
 
  
  
  Education Requirements: 
  
  High School Diploma or equivalent, and 1-2 years of relevant experience 
  Bachelor’s degree is a plus
 
  
  
  Knowledge / Skills 
  
  Well-organized in a complex digital environment while working multiple cases at once; comfortable toggling between multiple programs and screens 
  Excellent, clear verbal and written communication skills 
  Strong time management skills and able to meet established deadlines 
  Thrives in a fast-paced environment 
  Exemplary attention to detail 
  Maintains confidentiality and professionalism in all settings 
  Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook); comfortability working in different technologies (e.g. Mainframe - Traditional Life Insurance and Vantage), OnBase, banking websites ) 
  Background check and fingerprinting required 
  Overtime work may be required, and may be requested on short notice
 
  
  
  Factors that lead to success: 
  
  You are a lifelong learner 
  You are a hunter for information 
  You communicate effortlessly and aren’t scared to ask questions 
  You enjoy teamwork and bringing out the best in your peers 
  You are motivated by helping others 
  You are flexible and adaptable 
  You work well on and with a team, yet independently thrive on driving for results 
  You deal comfortably with the uncertainty of change 
  You are curious and ask questions to get to the root cause of a problem
 
  
  
  The base compensation range represents the low and high end of the compensation range for this position. Actual compensation will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to qualifications, skills, competencies, location, and experience. The range listed is just one component of our total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include an annual bonus, quarterly bonuses, commissions, and other long-term incentive compensation, depending on the position. National Life offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401(k) retirement plan match, medical, dental, and vision insurance, paid holidays, and a generous paid time off plan, as well as other benefits. 
 National Life Group® is a trade name of National Life Insurance Company, Montpelier, VT – founded in 1848, Life Insurance Company of the Southwest, Addison, TX – chartered in 1955, and their affiliates. Each company of National Life Group is solely responsible for its own financial condition and contractual obligations. Life Insurance Company of the Southwest is not an authorized insurer in New York and does not conduct insurance business in New York. Equity Services, Inc., Member FINRA/SIPC, is a Broker/Dealer and Registered Investment Adviser affiliate of National Life Insurance Company. All other entities are independent of the companies of National Life Group. 
 Fortune 1000 status is based on the consolidated financial results of all National Life Group companies. 
 National Life Group 
 1 National Life Dr 
 Montpelier, VT 05604

 Site Disclosure and Privacy Policy

Job Description
  If you are results oriented, a team leader, and thrive in a commissioned sales environment, this is the place for you to build your career. As a member of our beauty team, you’ll play a dual role—part artist, part teacher.
 
  A day in the life…
 
   Build long-lasting relationships with customers who have a passion for the latest cosmetics, beauty and fragrance trends. From greeting them in the store and suggesting new styles to checking in with them later and inviting them to exclusive events and promotions
   Give honest, tactful feedback and guidance to customers on beauty products
   Set and exceed company and personal sales goals while supporting the goals of the team
   Set and achieve sales goals, for both in-store and digital selling with effective use of selling tools (inclusive of text and social media)
   Build and maintain strong vendor relationships to maximize business results
   Manage the scheduling and execution of vendor events and promotions
   Be a great team player by doing your part to keep the department ready for its close-up, including stocking, re-merchandising, display, merchandise transfers and light cleaning
 
 
  You own this if you have…
 
   Competitive drive and entrepreneurial confidence to succeed in a commission-based environment
   The ability to positively and proactively handle customer concerns and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
   A high level of ownership, accountability and initiative
   The ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs, including evenings and weekends
 
 
  We’ve got you covered…
 
  Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:
 
   Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
   Life Insurance and Disability
   Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources
 
 
  A few more important points...
 
  The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.
 
  Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
 
  Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.
 
  © 2022 Nordstrom, Inc
 
  Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.
positionName: Beauty Counter Manager - Lancôme - NorthPark Center

description:
Job title: Print Senior Specialist – Marketing
Location: Plano, TX
Summary: 
The Print Senior Specialist will oversee the planning and execution of client weekly ads and direct mail. The position will lead the briefing process, creative review and delivery of each weekly ad and mailer with input from product marketing, promotions, analytics and leadership. The position requires strong project management skills, cross-functional collaboration and attention to detail.
Primary Responsibilities: 
Serves as primary point of contact for Weekly Ad & Direct Mail, fulfilling and directing tasks during strategy, planning, execution, briefing, creative review, and implementation.
Effectively understands the promotional plan & the retail/product lifecycle to adapt channel plans to best fulfill both client needs & customers’ needs.
Keeps track of upcoming/planned media and works to implement the channel's needs in a timely manner.
Works to integrate the needs of the JCPenney brand, product marketing & merchandising and creative to tell a cohesive message through the marketing channel.
Actively collaborates and communicates with stakeholders across all levels, providing continuous and transparent communication.
Ensures brand launches, events, and partnerships are adequately supported within the channel to support marketing's key stories.
Maintains working relationships with outside partners & vendors.
Reviews weekly performance reporting, and shares out results to leadership, using learnings to influence future activities.
Identifies and manages issues to resolution.
Identifies and recommends areas of improvement or efficiency to further strengthen performance in the channel.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required
2-4 years of experience in a marketing role with strong understanding of marketing principles, channels & tactics, production & deployment, and implications of upstream/downstream decisions
Knowledge of direct mail & digital ad best practices, print & digital production, and audience & offer selection.
Requires attention to detail, excellent project management skills, good communication and problem-solving skills, and ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at once.
Must be able to guide & influence cross-functional teams on expectations & deliverables and enforce completion & deadlines.
Creative problem solving and sense of ownership. Must be comfortable adjusting on the fly when there are changes in scope, deadlines or asset availability
Ability to work well under tight deadlines in a fast-paced and team-oriented environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office with ability to learn new software systems to support the job function.
Job Type: Contract
Salary: $25.00 - $27.00 per hour
Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

 How many years of experience you have in Direct mail?

Experience:

 Marketing: 2 years (Required)
 Digital marketing: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road
Speak with the employer+91 7908533329

About Us
  
  
    Founded in 1973, O’Neil Digital Solutions (ODS) is a leading IT consulting firm specializing in the optimization of complex end-to-end business process systems for a multitude of business verticals including Financial Services, Digital Media, Healthcare, and Transportation industries. ODS provides high-touch bespoke software engineering, systems integration, and infrastructure management services to clients of all sizes and industries. From large scale mass communication projects to highly secure and confidential data analytics using Big Data frameworks like Hadoop and AWS Redshift, ODS has a broad set of proven technical capabilities that help companies make complex digital transformations. ODS offers state of the art publishing solutions through our customer-centric applications and services include electronic document delivery, web applications, high-speed digital printing (color and black & white), automated composition, offset printing, warehousing and fulfillment services. ODS is headquartered in Los Angeles, CA and also has offices/plants in Texas and North Carolina centrally located to serve clients across the country.
  
 
 
  
    Summary
  
  
    The Inserter Operator I is responsible for setting up, operating, and maintaining equipment used to fold, match, and insert multiple pieces of printed material into envelopes.
  
 
 
  
    Duties and Responsibilities
  
  
   
     Set up inserting equipment at the beginning of each job according to the specifications provided on the job ticket
     Insert address tags into mail sacks, or mail trays used for bulk mailing of ID cards, kits, and catalogs
     Maintain equipment, troubleshoot problems, and perform preventative maintenance on equipment as needed
     Keep work area in order and follow prescribed safety regulations
     Able to read postal statements and sort mail accordingly
     Make adjustments as required to return output to the proper specifications
     Direct and supervise the work of helpers on the machine
     Detects and reports defective materials or questionable conditions to the department manager
     Communicates status of jobs to department manager
     Follow standard operating procedures according to the department’s guidelines
     Perform other duties as assigned
   
  
 
 
  
    Qualifications & Requirements
  
  
   
     A minimum of two years' experience in printing or mail inserting environment (operating either Pitney Bowes, Kern or Bell and Howell Inserters is a plus) is a plus
     High school graduate, or completion of GED preferred
     Perform all work and activities with honesty and integrity
     Take personal responsibility for productivity, quality and timeliness of work
     Effectively communicate (and listen) clearly, professionally, politely and persuasively in all situations; respond well and in a reasonable, timely manner
     Challenge conventional practices and use creativity and information to lead, innovate, problem solve, and implement ideas to contribute to the growth of the organization
     Support and meet company/department goals and core values
     Collaborate with co-workers to achieve common goals
   
  
 
 
  
    Working Conditions
  
  
    Must be able to perform the essential job duties. Work may be performed in an office, warehouse and/or manufacturing environment. Requires the ability to perform the following activities for the majority of the day: stand for extended periods of time, walk, bend, stoop, kneel, crouch, or climb. In addition, requires the ability to lift and/or push up to 50 pounds. May be exposed to noise and be required to wear hearing protection for the duration of the shift.
  
 
 
  
    Equal Opportunity Employer
  
  
    O'Neil Digital Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Position Overview 
  Successful State Farm Agent is seeking a qualified professional to join their winning team for the role of Receptionist - State Farm Agent Team Member (Social Media Focus). We seek an energetic professional interested in helping our business grow through value-based conversations and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential. 
  Responsibilities 
 
  
  Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification. 
  Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals. 
  Work with the agent to develop and maintain a digital marketing system to promote the office. 
 
 As an Agent Team Member, you will receive... 
 
  
  Simple IRA 
  Group Life Insurance Benefits 
  Hourly pay plus commission/bonus 
  Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my agency 
 
 Requirements 
 
  
  Excellent interpersonal skills 
  People-oriented 
  Organizational skills 
  Self-motivated 
  Dedicated to customer service 
  Must be available to work the following schedule: Monday-Thursday, 8:15am-5:15pm, Friday is 8:15am -5pm 
  
 If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process. 
  This position is with a State Farm independent contractor agent, not with State Farm Insurance Companies. Employees of State Farm agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. State Farm agents are independent contractors who hire their own employees. State Farm agents’ employees are not employees of State Farm.
positionName: Receptionist - State Farm Agent Team Member

description:
Job no: 503384
   
  Work type: Full-time
   
  Location: District Service Center
   
 
 
  Working Title 
   Senior Manager– Digital Engagement UX/UI Research & Training 
   Job Title Code 
   DLE  Salary Level 
   N06  Salary Range (Full-Time) 
   $65,000+ (commensurate with education and experience)  Hourly Rate (Part-Time) 
   $31.25 per hour  Business Travel 
   N/A 
   FLSA 
   Exempt  Position Type 
   Staff  Position Summary 
   Implements and coordinates software/systems training programs for the purpose of enhancing the knowledge and skills of Dallas College employees. Oversees the day-to-day activities of the software/systems training team responsible for providing training and support to end users related to software/systems purchased and supported by the institution. Schedules and forecasts training needs based on previous trends and future direction of the institution. Provides metrics and statistical analysis to leadership on the relative success of the learning effort of the team. Project partner in the development and application of new deployments for software acquired and supported by Dallas College and its partners.
    Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities 
   
   Ability to instruct on a range of different software applications used throughout businesses, in addition to being knowledgeable on modern training delivery techniques using virtual means. Ability to assess individual/group training needs and develop/deliver learning activities. Must be able to keep IT skills and knowledge up to date through professional development activities. 
   Committed learner and early adopter of technologies with a keen mindset to leverage our existing solutions in a manner that best promotes productivity and enables Dallas College stakeholders find modern solutions to their day-to-day activities. 
   Must be able to use technology such as distance learning or video conferencing. Track record in designing and executing successful training programs. Ability to plan, multitask and manage time effectively. Able to manage multiple projects that are complex in nature and broad in scope. Demonstrated ability to evaluate the effectiveness of learning materials. Knowledge of adult instructional and learning theory and principles. 
   Ability to build and maintain effective and cooperative working relationships with diverse staff members and colleagues. Commitment to diversity and to serving the needs of a diverse population having a wide range of system and applications literacy. Proven skills to collaborate within and across departments to coordinate training and development activities and resolve problems. Interpersonal skills to maintain professional relationships with internal/external stakeholders and constituents. Demonstrated ability to work effectively individually and in a team environment, modeling integrity and ethical behavior. 
   Ability to support innovation and organizational changes needed to improve the organization’s effectiveness. Strong technical aptitude to understand basic product structure and internal components and product functionality/applications. Knowledge of various training mediums, such as online learning, classroom learning and lectures. Excellent attention to detail, problem solving and critical thinking skills. 
   Ability to convey learning content clearly and succinctly in a manner that engages learners. Strong ability to give clear direction and sequence information verbally so others can follow and understand. Must have excellent interpersonal, presentation, verbal, and written communication skills. Strong commitment to a diverse working environment and to serving the needs of a large and diverse community. Excellent communication, customer service and leadership skills.
  
   
   Physical Requirements 
   Normal physical job functions performed within a standard office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to individuals with physical challenges to perform the essential duties and responsibilities. Occasionally may be required to lift and carry materials weighing up to 30 pounds. 
   Minimum Knowledge and Experience 
   
   Bachelor’s degree in related field plus two (2) years of work-related experience. 
   Must have current and valid Texas driver’s license required for off-site travel. 
   On-call, work hours may extend beyond the regular, eight hours, Monday-Friday, workday, including weekends and holidays to provide immediate support due to system failures on a 24/7 basis. 
   Official transcripts will be required. 
   
  ***Will be subject to a criminal background check. Some positions may be subject to a fingerprint check. ***
    Essential Duties and Responsibilities
   
   
   
    Responsible for the development and implementation of training programs for end users related to computer programs, software, and network systems supported by the Institution. Conducts needs assessment and training facilitation via a variety of delivery methods (web-based, classroom and on-demand). Designs and develops course materials, handouts, instructional aids, audio visual materials and similar teaching aids. Develop testing and evaluation procedures. Continuously enhance technical instructional delivery and presentation skills by staying up to date on trends and best practices through professional development activities. 
    A demonstrated life-long learner with attention paid to upskilling in modern software solutions with demonstrated innovation applied in the design and deployment of the team and their resources. Manages the online presence of the team in terms of SharePoint community and team sites and engages with marketing to bring modern solutions to the stakeholders. 
    Takes a proactive approach to the scheduling of content and forecasts the training needs of staff and students of the institution including those new to Dallas College to ensure our software/ systems are not a barrier to efficient onboarding. 
    Determines training needs by meeting with stakeholders and constituents. Aligns training with the needs of the end user or the organization’s strategic goals. Adopts a UX/UI perspective to the design and implementation of training to ensure training meets the needs/ preferences of a diverse population of stakeholders. 
    Responsible for development of, tracking, and reporting of training metrics for training effectiveness, student engagement, and other relevant data. 
    Develops and maintains relevant training modules related to hardware and software applications supported by the institution. 
    Acts as a quality assurance review resource for all newly generated and existing training content at Dallas College. 
    Coordinates training logistics, delivery, and travels to various Dallas College locations, as necessary. 
    Builds and maintains effective working relationships with diverse internal/external stakeholders and constituents within the DCCCD network community to provide effective consultation, support, and/or training to end users. 
    Functions as a member of the IT team collaborating with implementation teams, project managers, support, and product owners to analyze, develop and document training based on applicable product and/or system. 
    Leads virtual and in-person Instructor led training sessions as needs arise to fill any momentary team gaps to meet the demands of stakeholder training requirements. 
    Provides project management and business analyst skillset in the coordination and collaboration of large-scale IT projects and works as a cross- functional asset in an adaptive capacity to ensure prompt delivery of solutions to stakeholders. 
    Creates, develops, and oversees training processes and procedures, ensuring compliance with Dallas College policies and guidelines. Responsible for planning, development and implementation of new curriculum, revisions and/or updates to existing applications. Oversees the day-to-day activities of team members providing mentoring, coaching, training, evaluation, and development. Conducts regular SCRUM meetings to coordinate the project activities of the training team. 
    Ensure new team members are onboarded to the highest level of technical proficiency, engages in the professional development of the team with yearly goals setting and provision of curated training content in the team meetings/ workshops. 
    Actively engages with IT managers from other functional areas to stay appraised of developments in the IT landscape of the College and attends Change advisory, IT council and Digital engagement Council meetings. 
    Coordinates overall learning and development efforts by engaging with other leaders in the Dallas College professional development sphere. E.g. Representatives from Human relations, Learning and Development and the Center for excellence in Teaching and Learning. 
    Utilizes excellent communication skills when interacting with diverse, multicultural individuals internal/external to the DCCCD network community. Monitors and evaluates the success and effectiveness of training programs and return on investment (ROI) periodically, providing reports as requested. Strong writing skills with excellent attention to detail. Provides exemplary customer service. 
   
  
  
   Completes required Dallas College Professional Development training hours per academic year. 
   Performs other duties as assigned. 
   
  The intent of this job description is to provide a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Incumbents may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. Position requires regular and predictable attendance. 
   Dallas College is part of an equal opportunity system that provides education and employment opportunities without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. Dallas College complies with the Americans with Disabilities and Veterans Act. 
  
 Advertised: 14 Nov 2022 Central Standard Time Applications close: 25 Nov 2022 11:55 PM Central Standard Time
positionName: Senior Manager– Digital Engagement UX/UI Research & Training

description:
Seeking Spanish Speaking Talented Individuals for Our Management Training Program at our Mesquite Texas location! Must be bilingual in Spanish and English 
 Are you looking for more than a JOB? Do you desire to have an opportunity CREATE a great life for yourself? 
 Come Join the Stanley Family! TEXT "SALES10" TO 972-630-4473 TO APPLY NOW 
 Opportunity to create annual income from $48,000 to $80,000 and beyond! 
 We pay you while you train! No Experience Necessary! 
 Competitive Compensation Package including Employer sponsored Healthcare benefits, Paid Time Off, 401k Participation, Opportunity to Grow! 
 Qualified candidates will have the opportunity to learn the business from the ground up by starting their program as an Automotive Sales Consultant. They will have an opportunity to participate in industry leading training programs as they develop their skills through formal and on the job dealership training they will receive as they are mentored through the program. 
 Top performers may be considered for our manager trainee program. 
 Our Group is dedicated to investing time and resources in our people. Come Grow with Us! 
 Strong Internet Skills are a plus! 
 Job Perks! 
 
  Employer sponsored benefits after probationary period 
  Paid Time Off after probationary period 
  401k participation eligibility after 6 months of service 
  
 Job Requirements 
 
  Digital and Social Media Marketing Experience a Plus! 
  Self-Starter 
  Ability to invest a significant amount of personal time and energy outside business hours to the education and training process 
  Strong Auto Sales and/or Customer Service Experience is a Plus but not required 
  Strong Ethics and Values 
  Excellent Leadership and Communication Skills 
  Excellent People Skills 
  Must Pass Background and Drug Screen 
  Must have valid driver’s license and pass motor vehicle record test 
 
 
  Come Join the Stanley Family!

At PMG, we exist to inspire all people to feel that anything is possible personally and professionally. It's what powers us to deliver value, innovation, results, and Digital Made for Humans™ for the world's most ambitious brands by bringing a more human-centric approach to digital. 
  
  
   
    
     SUMMARY: 
      Momentum is a collection of companies built to power digital commerce. Our companies are led by the brightest minds and driven by data & insights. The Corporate Development Analyst will support a global finance function which is integrated across the Momentum organization through shared systems, processes, and best practices. The Corporate Development Analyst will assist in driving the inorganic growth strategy of Momentum and its portfolio companies as the group continues to grow and evolve. This critical role will contribute to the execution of various aspects of the M&A process. The successful candidate will work collaboratively both with the corporate development team and across departments to assist in pipeline management, financial analysis, modeling, due diligence, reporting, and integration efforts. 
      The ideal candidate will have an understanding of accounting and finance concepts, strong analytical & communication skills, attention to detail, the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously, and a desire to take ownership of deliverables, at times working autonomously. Momentum offers a fast-paced, challenging, fun, and rewarding environment in which the successful candidate will have the opportunity to learn and grow in multiple disciplines across corporate development, finance, and the broader shared services organization. 
      GENERAL DESCRIPTION: 
      
      Provide financial analysis and support across a variety of areas including, but not limited to, revenue and expense budgeting, forecasting and analysis, consolidation and presentation of financial results, deal modeling and / or investment case modeling, foreign currency analysis, cash flow forecasting and analysis, and other ad hoc projects 
      Develop and maintain complex Excel financial models, continuously finding ways to innovate and reduce time to complete key tasks 
      Produce frequent financial and key performance indicator reports including variance analysis and trends 
      Support the Corporate Development team in management of the opportunity pipeline through proactive outreach and conversations with investment professionals 
      Assist the Corporate Development team with other duties and projects, as needed, to drive strategic and financial decisions 
      
     SKILLS & EXPERIENCE NEEDED: 
      
      BS/BA degree in finance or accounting is required – Internship experience in corporate development, private equity, investment banking, or deal advisory is a plus 
      Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is required – Knowledge of Vena, Hyperion Essbase, and / or QuickBooks is a plus 
      Analytical, accurate, detail-oriented, and a self-starter – Able to meet deadlines and work successfully in a fast-paced environment 
      Proficient in data mining – Able to quickly convert large amounts of information into a useable format and interpret trends to support financial decisions 
      Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills – Able to communicate and work effectively with stakeholders across multiple business functions
     
     
       
       
      About PMG: 
       PMG is a global independent digital company that seeks to inspire people and brands that anything is possible. Driven by shared success, PMG uses strategy, creative, media, and insights, as well as its proprietary marketing intelligence platform Alli, to deliver Digital Made for Humans™. Our team is made up of over 500 employees globally, and our work for brands like Apple, Athleta, Best Western Hotels & Resorts, Kohler, McDonald's, Nike, Old Navy, Sephora and Shake Shack runs across 85+ countries and has received top industry recognition from Cannes Lions to Adweek Media Plan of the Year. 
       Ranked by Deloitte, Inc., Entrepreneur, and Adweek as one of the fastest-growing companies in the nation, PMG has grown because of its commitment to continuous improvement, business integrity, cultivating dynamic relationships, and putting people first. The company has been named Adweek's Breakthrough Media Agency of the Year, MediaPost's Independent Agency of the Year, 7X Ad Age Best Places to Work, 3X Best Places for Working Parents, and one of Fast Company's Best Workplaces for Innovators. 
       Being part of PMG means being part of a company culture that's unmatched in digital. We're willing to work hard to serve our clients and deliver value, results, and innovation - which often requires true grit and remaining agile. We believe in taking care of ourselves and each other so that we continuously improve in every way. 
       We'd love to get to know you and share more about why we love PMG and the work we do. 
       Join us in making digital more human Apply Now 
       In alignment with our core values to be inclusive and always change for the better, PMG is committed to creating a more diverse and inclusive culture, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe we only change for the better by bringing different people to our company. PMG recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Learn more about our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion and our action plan for change here.

Department: Labor Relations 

 Our Company Promise 

 We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer. 

 
Job Description:
 All of Southwest’s People come together to deliver on our Purpose; Connecting People to what’s important in their lives through friendly, reliable, and low-cost air travel. The Labor Communication Specialist support s the department's communication initiatives, which include planning, writing, cross-functional coordination, seeking input and approval, monitoring social channels, and tracking communication. The Labor Communication Specialist is a detail-oriented and strategic thinker who is excited to partner with the Labor Communication s Team, Negotiating Teams, Operation Leaders, Communication Advisors, and external Stakeholders to deliver communication and update plans . 

 
As a Labor Communication Specialist, you can expect:
 Fly for free, as a privilege, on any open seat on all Southwest flights—your eligible dependents too. 

 Up to a 9.3% 401(k) Company match, dollar for dollar, per paycheck.* 

 Potential for annual ProfitSharing contribution toward retirement - when Southwest profits, you profit.* * 

 
Explore more Benefits you’ll love: swa.is/benefits 

 U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available. 

 For eligible Leadership and individual contributor roles, additional bonus opportunities are available and awarded at the discretion of the Company. 

 Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We continue to look for opportunities to reflect the communities we serve, and welcome applicants with diverse thoughts, backgrounds, and experiences. 
Responsibilities 
Write and design communications for Leaders and Employees including memos, letters, negotiation updates, toolkits, presentations, digital signs, resource guides, pamphlets, video scripts, banners, and articles 
Develop and provide training to internal Customers on the appropriate use, content, design, workflows, and changes associated with communication platforms 
Develop communication strategies for the delivery of corporate culture and business strategy 
Partner with Department Leadership and Labor Relations Teams to gather information regarding strategic planning for contract negotiations and long-term goals 
Partner, communicate, and build relationships to gather Customer and business requirements and communicate effectively on behalf of Sr. Leadership 
Monitor industry news and union communications relating to labor negotiations 
Monitor, document, and archive incoming and outgoing labor communications 
Assist with updating and reviewing the Labor Negotiations website for relevancy, consistency, and accuracy 
Edit, standardize, or make changes to material prepared by other writers or department personnel 
Act as a representative on negotiating Teams, working to secure new contracts with unionized groups 
May perform other job duties as directed by Employees Leaders 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 
Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods including alternative ways to inform and entertain using written, oral, and visual media 
Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar 
Skilled in understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making 
Skilled in giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times 
Skilled in Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience 
Ability to listen, understand, and communicate ideas presented in writing and speaking with others 
Ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem 
Ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing 
Education 

Required: High School Diploma or GED 
Experience 
Entry level experience; developing skills and knowledge in planning, monitoring, writing, and coordination of internal and external communications 
Licensing/Certification 
N/A 
Physical Abilities 
Ability to perform work duties from [limited space work station/desk/office area] for extended periods of time 
Ability to communicate and interact with others in the English language to meet the demands of the job 
Ability to use a computer and other office productivity tools with sufficient speed and accuracy to meet the demands of the job 
Other Qualifications 
Must maintain a well-groomed appearance per Company appearance standards as described in established guidelines 
Must be a U.S. citizen or have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986 
Must be at least 18 years of age 
Must be able to comply with Company attendance standards as described in established guidelines 

 
 
 401(k) match contributions are subject to the plan’s vesting schedule and applicable IRS limits 
 ** ProfitSharing contributions are subject to plan’s vesting schedule and are made at the discretion of the Company 

 Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 
Please print/save this job description because it won't be available after you apply.

Suntex Marinas is a high growth real-estate company investing exclusively in mixed-use marinas and their operating platforms. Over the last 20 years, we have acquired, developed, and operated more than 65 full-service marinas which also include retail spaces, office buildings, resorts, hotels, and restaurants in the United States. Over these years, we have developed a solid reputation by being dedicated to our customers, clients, guests, communities, employees, and investors.
Suntex Marinas is looking for a Graphic Designer to join our growing organization and work with the Marketing Team at our Home Office in Dallas, TX.
Job Functions

 Work collaboratively in a fast-paced, creative team environment
 Demonstrate a strong understanding and application of brand guidelines and brand identity principles
 Design creative across multiple platforms, including:

Logos and brand identity
Print collateral and advertisements
Digital ads, websites, and landing pages
Social media post templates
Signage and banners
Uniforms
Powerpoint presentations
Magazines
Booth graphics

 Ensure photography and videography library is complete, organized and meets the needs of the organization
 Keep design files organized and accessible to the team
 Communicate effectively with teams to ensure design output meets the requirements of the job
 Collaborate effectively across multiple teams, departments, and individuals to ideate innovative designs
 Take ownership of results

Qualification

 Advanced education in Graphic Design, Advertising or similar discipline is preferred
 1-3 years’ experience in graphic design or marketing
 Portfolio demonstrating a variety of design work and the ability to take a project from concept to completion
 A collaborative approach to projects with the ability to respond professionally to creative direction and constructive feedback
 Self-motivated with the ability to work with minimal supervision
 High level of time management, organizational skills, and attention to detail
 Ability to multitask and meet deadlines
 Strong understanding of digital platforms with the ability to provision design solutions across multiple digital platforms, light html experience preferred
 Experience with a wide range of design platforms, including Adobe Creative Suite
 A high level of professionalism and champion of company values is required

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $50,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 401(k)
 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Employee discount
 Flexible schedule
 Health insurance
 Health savings account
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Professional development assistance
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

 Bonus pay

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Dallas, TX 75252: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: One location

Who We Are 
  We're a cast of characters working to shine a spotlight on anime. Crunchyroll is an international business focused on creating both online and offline experiences for fans through content (licensed, co-produced, originals, distribution), merchandise, events, gaming, news, and more. Visit our About Us pages for more information about our collection of brands. 
  About The Role 
  The VP, Internal Communications & Talent Brand sits within our People team and will be a key member of the People Leadership Team. Reporting to the Chief People Officer, this role will have global responsibility over Internal Communications, Talent Brand/Employer Brand, and Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) functions. This role is highly cross functional and will be a key partner to Crunchyroll leadership and many team members across the business. The role requires a high-impact leader with a rich blend of experiences, across a range of companies at varied stages of growth and maturity; a leader who knows what great looks like (from an employee experience perspective) in a scaled organization. 
  
  Delegate and lead internal communications and employer brand team members, investing in their growth and development. 
  Define and execute on a consistent and engaging internal communications strategy in partnership with the leadership team. 
  Build a strong, external employer brand that is well-positioned to attract exceptional, values-aligned talent to the company. 
  Build and manage our CSR initiatives, such as charitable giving, pro-social campaigns, and volunteer time off (VTO) program. 
  Use your creative vision to ensure that company initiatives and projects are successfully communicated to employees with consistent voice/tone. 
  Make use of multiple delivery mediums (including visually rich, digital modes of delivery) to enhance engagement and uptake of messaging. 
  Resolve necessary internal knowledge management infrastructure and workflows required to support an employee intranet and other employee communications. 
  Plan, edit and write content for a variety of internal communications channels (ie. internal resource sites, company all staff meetings, email, internal social channels). 
  Draft messages or scripts from senior executives for presentation to employees in written or spoken form. 
  Ensure internal messages are consistent and connected across all mediums and for different departments within the company. 
  Ensure internal messages are consistent and appropriately timed relative to external messages, where applicable. 
 
 Location: Dallas 
  Our Dallas office is centrally located within the Metroplex, making it convenient and easily accessible for our team members from across the Dallas-Fort Worth Area. 
  About You: 
  Your creative flair inspires a preference towards delivering visually rich, digital communication experiences to help employees connect to the company's mission and strategy, serve as advocates for the brand, and embrace our values. You'll participate in driving a highly informed team by using creative and engaging approaches to make ideas and information easily discoverable, consumable and memorable. While you lead with a creative spirit, you are equally oriented around driving complex projects in an organized and expeditious way. You believe that communication designed to inspire our employee audience should be as creative and compelling as anything that would be delivered to our community of anime fans. You are both the producer and director of high quality and highly engaging communication experiences that tell our internal story. 
  
  You have 10+ years experience working across a diverse portfolio of companies and industries, and across at least two of internal communications, employer brand, recruitment marketing and/or corporate social responsibility. 
  You have experience using creative approaches to tackling communication challenges in engaging ways. 
  You possess excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills as well as the journalistic ability to source stories from employees. 
  You have experience creating employer brand or recruitment marketing content for social media, digital and physical channels and events. 
  Having additional experience writing for a variety of different audiences, either personally or professionally, is highly desirable. 
  You are deeply passionate about the role corporate social responsibility initiatives can play in attracting and engaging mission-aligned talent. 
  You are an experienced leader with the capability of understanding the lowest level of detail and demonstrating a willingness to "roll up your sleeves" to get things done. 
  You're adept at leading the work of a team, delegating and assigning work and owning team outcomes. You combine the need to empower a team with the understanding that delegation should be relative to capability to ensure success. 
  You have tremendous leadership capacity and you have a successful track record of building and growing high-performing teams. 
  You love to tackle hard problems and believe that well-executed communication has the ability to create order out of chaos. 
  You thrive in environments where there is a high-degree of ambiguity and things are prone to rapid change. You are a steady rock when the seas of change can be choppy. 
  You possess the ability to influence team members and build relationships at all levels of the organization. 
  You thrive in environments where you can use your super powers of strong problem solving and critical thinking skills while exercising sound judgment. 
  You have proven experience handling confidential and sensitive information. You exercise discretion and show good judgment; honesty, integrity, and trust-building behaviors in all dealings. 
  You are adaptable with a keen ability to fly high (focused on strategy) or low (focused on execution) as needed. 
 
 Benefits: 
 
  Competitive salary 
  "Use What You Need" time away from work policy 
  Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, and life insurance 
  Health care and dependent care FSA 
  401(k) plan with employer match 
  Employer paid commuter benefit 
  Support program for new parents 
  Fun, passionate and skilled co-workers 
  Pet friendly - pet insurance 
  
 Questions about Crunchyroll's hiring process? Please check out our FAQ 
  Please beware of recent scams to online job seekers. Those applying to our job openings will only be contacted directly from @crunchyroll.com email accounts. If you have any questions of the authenticity of a Crunchyroll job offer, please contact recruiting@crunchyroll.com before giving away any information. 
  About Crunchyroll 
  Crunchyroll connects anime and manga fans across 200+ countries and territories with the content and experiences they love. In addition to free ad-supported and subscription premium content, Crunchyroll serves the anime community across events, theatrical, games, consumer products, collectibles and manga publishing. 
  Anime fans have access to one of the largest collections of licensed anime through Crunchyroll and translated in multiple languages for viewers worldwide. Viewers can also access simulcasts — top series available immediately after Japanese broadcast. 
  The Crunchyroll app is available on over 15 platforms, including all gaming consoles. 
  Crunchyroll, LLC is an independently operated joint venture between US-based Sony Pictures Entertainment, and Japan's Aniplex, a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment (Japan) Inc., both subsidiaries of Tokyo-based Sony Group Corporation. 
  Our Company Values 
  You'll see these in action if we're lucky enough to have you: 
  
  Courage - When we overcome fear, we enable our best selves. 
  Curiosity - We are curious, which is the gateway to empathy, inclusion, and understanding. 
  Service - We serve our community with humility, enabling joy and belonging for others. 
  Kaizen - We have a growth mindset committed to constant forward progress. 
  
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Crunchyroll. Pursuant to applicable law, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 
  #LifeAtCrunchyroll #LIHybrid
positionName: Vice President, Internal Communications & Talent Brand

description:
About Us
  
  
    Founded in 1973, O’Neil Digital Solutions (ODS) is a leading IT consulting firm specializing in the optimization of complex end-to-end business process systems for a multitude of business verticals including Financial Services, Digital Media, Healthcare, and Transportation industries. ODS provides high-touch bespoke software engineering, systems integration, and infrastructure management services to clients of all sizes and industries. From large scale mass communication projects to highly secure and confidential data analytics using Big Data frameworks like Hadoop and AWS Redshift, ODS has a broad set of proven technical capabilities that help companies make complex digital transformations. ODS offers state of the art publishing solutions through our customer-centric applications and services include electronic document delivery, web applications, high-speed digital printing (color and black & white), automated composition, offset printing, warehousing and fulfillment services. ODS is headquartered in Los Angeles, CA and also has offices/plants in Texas and North Carolina centrally located to serve clients across the country.
  
 
 
  
    Summary
  
  
    The Client Advocate I priority is to support the day-to-day management of client’s business activities, and will be responsible for the internal job production SLA monitoring, invoicing, and reporting.
  
 
 
  
    Duties and Responsibilities
  
  
   
     Plan and strategize with management on direction of client business
     Responsible for partnering with the Client Operations Team to monitoring all daily print production/ File sweeps/ File Reconciliation/ Job Monitoring/Print File verification and quality check
     Manage entire production workflow of client projects (data processing, printing, fulfillment, mailing, invoicing, reporting, inventory management)
     Responsible to oversee and track client SLAs and performance metrics
     Pro-active management and timely response to client inquiries and needs
     Collaborate with the Client Operations team in management of client Inventory including: NAV Kit Matrix, bulk shipments, Collateral Print Estimates/Proposals, and purchase orders
     Plan and maintain capacity and load balance in coordination with production management
     Collaborate with the Production Engineering team on new projects and production setups
     Creation, submission and management of all tasks in Jira
     Works closely with the IT team on submitting & prioritizing client requests
     Responsible for researching and resolving production related issues
     Liaison between the clients and all internal departments
     Develop, manage and maintain client reporting and adhoc reporting
     Responsible for updating and maintaining client specific information in confluence which include Standard Operating Procedures
     Perform other duties as assigned
   
  
 
 
  
    Qualifications & Requirements
  
  
   
     Bachelor's degree from an accredited four-year college or university is required
     Three (3) years of relevant work experience in client services, project planning, and strategic planning in vertical markets (i.e. Healthcare, Financial Services, Retail, etc.)
     Proficient with Microsoft Office products (MS Word, MS Excel) and Jira/confluence is a plus
     Must have a keen attention to detail, a strong work ethic, and the ability to thrive in a team environment
     Entry-Level
     Requires moderate day-to-day direction in regards to solving problems and providing timely responses
     Good Interpersonal and communication skills
     Good at collaborating with co-workers to achieve company/department goals and values.
     Has a basic knowledge of Technical processes
   
  
 
 
  
    Working Conditions
  
  
    Must be able to perform the essential job duties. Work is performed primarily in an office environment. Typically requires the ability to sit for extended periods of time (66%+ each work day), ability to hear the telephone, ability to enter data on a computer and may also require the ability to lift up to 10 pounds.
  
 
 
  
    Equal Opportunity Employer
  
  
    O'Neil Digital Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

$23.65 per hour 

 HIRING IMMEDIATELY!!! 

 Job Details 

 
 
 $23.65 per hour 
 Full Time 
 Job Description 

 As the contracted staffing firm for DFW International Airport, we are seeking a Social Media Specialist/Multimedia Specialist. 

 
GENERAL SUMMARY:
 Under general direction of the Content and Creative Services Manager, the Communications and Marketing Multimedia Specialist creates dynamic photographic, video, graphic design, animation and/or written content for social media platforms, executive presentations, digital and traditional marketing, and internal channels, helping to promote the Airport’s reputation and achieve its key results in DFW’s Strategic Plan. 

 
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
 
 Creates photographic, video, graphic design, animation and/or written content for all communications and marketing channels, contributing to the overall brand and for DFW Airport. 
 Coordinates posting of select multimedia content and other Communications and Marketing content to DFW’s owned, earned and paid channels, meeting all deadlines and budget requirements. 
 Collaborates with colleagues to create and inspire unique, memorable content that enhances the DFW brand, adhering to brand guidelines and integrating consistent messages and tone across multiple channels. 
 Develops multimedia content (videos, speeches and PowerPoint) for Airport executives to present to external audiences, ranging from key stakeholders and community groups to airport and aviation conferences. 
 Coordinates, analyzes, distributes and explains data and/or metrics related to media content of interest to the Airport. 
 Assists in production of a variety of collateral materials for the Communications & Marketing, such as handouts, annual reports, event programs, newsletters, brochures, media/event summaries, maps, slide presentations, etc., from concept design and layout to coordinating print production. 
 Assists with special events supported by Communications & Marketing. 
 Assists with emergency response and messaging during a crisis. 
 MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 

 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in business administration, public relations, communications, journalism, marketing or related field. 
 Three (3) years of experience creating visual content for social media, marketing, corporate communications, public relations or multi-media journalism. 
 Portfolio of professional work as a photographer, videographer, editor, graphic designer or multimedia communicator. 
 Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for the above. 
 Possession of a valid Class C driver’s license. 
 
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
 
 
 Strong knowledge of video and image editing software, practices and techniques. 
 Strong knowledge of digital and social media communication techniques and platforms. 
 Knowledge of Microsoft Office Programs, including Power Point and Share Point. 
 Knowledge of the principles and practices of project management and planning. 
 Ability to coordinate effectively with public agencies on project initiatives. 
 Ability to execute all forms of communication, including crisis communications techniques. 
 Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing at all levels within and outside the organization. 
 Ability to create and maintain databases, specifically but not limited to multi-media libraries, media impressions and social media engagement. 
 Ability to plan and direct projects from inception to completion. 
 Ability to work under tight deadlines with conflicting deadlines. 
 Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with other Airport departments, the public, media and other key constituent groups. 
 Ability to work independently and collaboratively with in a fast-paced, team environment. 
 
Education:
 
 
 Bachelor’s Degree (Required) 
 
Experience:
 
 
 Three (3) years of experience creating visual content for social media, marketing, corporate communications, public relations or multi-media journalism. 
 
Work Location:
 
 
 One location 
 “Equal Opportunity Employer – In accordance with federal and state equal opportunity laws, we will refer all quality candidates without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, age, or impairment.”
